definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
May you have a prosperous New Year! (New Year's greeting)
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)

sentences.english: We do have a remarkable talent for cooking up crazy get-rich schemes.
sentences.chinese: 在炮製瘋狂發財計劃方面，我們的確有過人才華。

sentences.english: Lotteries are being billed as a way to get wealth without saving and investing.
sentences.chinese: 彩票被描繪成不用投資和存錢就可以發財的捷徑。

sentences.english: In fact, the Japanese whale meat to the restaurant and hotel, just want to get rich.
sentences.chinese: 其實日本人把鯨肉送到菜館和飯店裏，就想發財。

sentences.english: With their dreams of finding fortunes, In this wild unsettled land.
sentences.chinese: 帶着他們的發財夢，來到這荒蠻的土地上。

sentences.english: Thus, war, for the officials, was always the swiftest and straightest road to riches.
sentences.chinese: 因此，戰爭永遠是地方官發財的捷徑。

sentences.english: Producers of potash, a key fertilizer, should prosper mightily from food inflation.
sentences.chinese: 主要肥料碳酸鉀的生產商，應能在食品漲價中發財。

sentences.english: “This just continues the well-established tradition of welfare for the student loan industry, ” said Barmak Nassirian, an expert in student lending.
sentences.chinese: “這繼續了學生貸款行業的發財傳統，”一個專家說。
說不定哪一天我們會發財的。

sentences.english: Today, the most rich road to riches are among our most popular thing.
sentences.chinese: 今天，最發財致富之道都在我們最常用的東西之中。
我有一個發財快的計謀。

sentences.english: Dirk cast away his old friends.
sentences.chinese: 德克發財時，拋棄了舊友。
火紅年，恭喜發財賀新年。

sentences.english: The real money in trading is made from the one, two or three large trades that develop each year.
sentences.chinese: 真正發財是靠一年那一兩三次賺大錢的買賣。

sentences.english: The run thinks is also many son many happiness , become rich prosperous.
sentences.chinese: 閏想得也就是多子多福，發財興旺。

sentences.english: If thing could be obtained merely by wishing for them, poor people would be rich.
sentences.chinese: 如果夢想能自動實現，叫花子都能發財了。

sentences.english: This painting as indicated in the mountain tiger "of the rich."
sentences.chinese: 該幅畫作爲預示發財的《下山虎》。

definition: to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
variant of 這裡|这里[zhe4 li3]
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
